summary: The Department of Defense offers health coverage to military servicemembers and retirees through TRICARE. Some beneficiaries—particularly those not enrolled in TRICARE’s managed care option—have raised concerns about finding doctors who accept their health coverage. We reviewed DOD's most recent survey of TRICARE beneficiaries who were not enrolled in the managed care option and found that their access to care improved since the last survey. Specifically...
title: Defense Health Care: TRICARE Surveys Indicate Nonenrolled Beneficiaries' Access to Care Has Generally Improved
